Recap: Will and Gwen talk about Crash; Will asks if she and Casey have plans to scout out new talent, after recalling his conversation with Barbara. Gwen tells him no, which seems to bother him. When Casey isn't sure that he'll be able to get Gwen to go on the trip to Chicago, Barbara pretty much rescinds her offer unless Gwen goes, claiming this was all about helping her daughter-in-law. Casey promises he will do everything in his power to get her to go. Carly comes to the station to pick up a sick Parker, but Jack sarcastically asks if she is there to meet Nick? When he sees Parker he apologizes; he can't help but still get jealous. Carly tells him it is a good thing because she knows how he feels; she is not going to get over him and she doesn't want Nick because she only wants him, and sooner or later he needs to stop denying his feelings. Emily comes to and sees Paul and assumes everything was a terrible dream, but when Susan tells her the neurologist will be in to see her and then she sees Meg outside, she realizes it is not a dream and cries out asking why they didn't let her die? The church is only available that night for Mike and Katie to get married, so they decide tonight is the night, as they start to make plans. Jade comes to see Lily after doing some laundry and she and Luke fight, which Lily partly overhears. Jade can't help but guilt Lily into having her around, by saying that she and Luke were fighting about her and the fact she doesn't want him happy with her. Casey meets up with Gwen and finally convinces her to come to Chicago with him for the day. Paul convinces Tom, strangely enough, to have Daniel come see his mom to give Emily something to live for. Emily finds out Paul saved her. She asks him why he did it  out of guilt? He just wants her to live and be happy because he cares for her still. She doesn't know what that means and shocks him when she asks if he will be there for her and will they be together after this? Mike and Katie go to Carly's to invite her to the wedding and in the end, Carly offers Katie a wedding dress she had before at BRO. Mike gets called to the station for questioning after tests came back on the skeleton, but he doesn't tell Katie. It seems the skeleton might be the woman who gave Mike the rubies. Jack shows him some evidence and Mike seems to recognize one of the items. Jade and Luke have another face off at Java and after she leaves, Will tries to talk to Luke, who is adamant that Jade is not his girlfriend. Gwen keeps trying to reach Will but he is occupied with Luke and does not hear his phone.
Transcript: Gwen: Have you seen my calculator, I have study group in 15 minutes I thought I put it --
Will: You don't need a calculator where you're headed. You're the real thing, I saw the crowd last night they couldn't get enough of you.

Gwen: That's because I was the only thing that wasn't pre-recorded. But thank you for being my number-one fan, thank you. And as much as I'd like to keep this going, you have to study. Harris is famous for giving impossible final exams.
Will: So stay and quiz me.
Gwen: What's going on with you?
Will: Nothing. I just miss you when you're gone.
Gwen: Yeah, we kind of had a good time last night.
Will: You kind of had a good time last night.
Gwen: Yeah, you were gonna tell me something about your mom. What'd she try to pull this time?

Barbara: Can you come through, that's the question. You said that you can get Gwen to go with you.
Casey: Right.
Barbara: So, where is she? I mean, you two need to get a move on if you're gonna make the opening act.

Casey: I haven't had a chance to go over the details with her yet. But if she's not free, I can still talk to my parents and see if they'll let me cover the bands by myself. I know it's a long shot, but I can at least try, right.
Barbara: Ah, no, Casey. That wasn't our agreement.

Jade: Well, why do you think I did this? I'm trying to help.

Mike: Tonight? Okay, when we told Margo it's going to be soon, I don't think she thought it was going to be this soon.

Katie: I know, me neither. But remember you -- a couple weeks ago, you said you wanted to elope. And then last night you seemed pretty happy about moving up the date, so -- I mean, unless you don't want to.
Mike: Katie --

Katie: Which I would understand if you don't want to, because it's such short notice. It's no notice, its tonight. Which means it's today, which means we have a lot to do. But you know what? If we let this skeleton thing get in the way of our happiness -- is that a yes?
Mike: That is "a shut up and marry me."

Hal: That, too.
Carly: Oh, sweetie. Oh, honey.

Paul: It's me. Look, I know things looked pretty bleak back there in the woods. But you're okay now. You're safe. And you're gonna find a way to move past all of this. But you gotta wake up. You gotta open your eyes, huh? And if you want to yell and scream at me -- throw things. It'd be okay, you know, I deserve that. Please, wake up. I'm right here. Em? Hey.
Emily: Paul?
Paul: How you feeling?
Emily: I had this dream -- this terrible dream. But you're here. We're together.
Paul: Well, the important thing is that you're awake.
Susan: Emily? How you feeling?
Emily: I'm happy.
Susan: The neurologist is going to want to speak to you.
Emily: Why?
Susan: Because -- you had an accident, a fall. You've been in a coma.
Emily: But I thought it was a dream.
Susan: No, baby, no.
Emily: Oh, my God! Why didn't you let me die?
Susan: No, Emily. Emily!
Emily: Oh, God, why didn't you let me die?
Susan: No, stop, stop, stop! Emily, stop.
[Emily screaming]
Paul: She's not going to hurt you --
Susan: Stop it! Right now! Stop it!
Emily: What do you care? You don't love me!
Susan: Emily --
Emily: Let go of me! Why didn't you let me die?
Susan: I do love you, you're my daughter.
Dr. Linn: How long's she been awake?
Susan: You're my daughter. You're my daughter but you've gotta calm down now. Come on, it's going to be all right.
Emily: It's not gonna be all right! Don't you understand? Nothing will ever be all right! I've lost everything!
Paul: Oh, no, that's not true --
Emily: Yes, I have! I've lost you! I'm going to jail! You're gonna move in with Meg! Get out! Get out of my room!
Susan: Get out of here.
Emily: Get out of my room!
Susan: Get out. Get out, please.
Emily: Get him out! Get him out!
Susan: He's out, he's out! It's gonna be all right. [Emily crying hysterically] It's gonna be all right. Okay, you just gotta rest, now.
Dr. Linn: I've got her.
Susan: Okay. Get rest!
Paul: She's awake. Looks like she's gonna make it.
Susan: Weren't you listening? She wants to die.

Paul: Yeah, well, that's because she didn't remember everything when she woke up, and then she did -- look, I had doubts about being at Emily's bedside when she -- when she woke up, but you're the one who said that it might help.
Susan: I -- I know what I said.

Paul: We both knew that she was gonna be hurt and angry. Look, she has every right to be. But the important thing is that she survived the fall, she's in good hands, she's gonna -- she's gonna be fine.
Susan: And then what? What's gonna happen to her when she's finally able to get out of bed? She's going to jail. Her life is over!
Meg: Well, that's not Paul's fault.
Susan: The hell it isn't. She was a vibrant, healthy, happy woman before she met you. And now look at her!
Meg: She's a mom, she feels helpless. She has to blame someone.
Paul: She has a point.
Meg: Before Emily hooked up with you, where was she? She was married to Hal and very unhappy. She glommed onto you because she knew she was about to go under.
Paul: But I didn't save her.
Meg: Okay, so you'll never be a St. Bernard. But you could use a haircut.
Paul: This from my little lhasa apso, huh?
Meg: Yeah, that would be me. Thanks.
Paul: You were here all night?
Meg: Yeah, I still have a friend or two on staff. They let me crash in the nurses' lounge.
Paul: You should go home.
Meg: Yeah, well, sorry but I've got this man that needs a little TLC.
Paul: Tom --
Tom: We have nothing to say to each other.
Paul: I'm sure you're right, but Emily's doing a little better. I'm a little worried about her.
Tom: Really? Well, it's about time.
Paul: Okay, look, she's out of the coma, but she's not doing so well emotionally. In fact, she was -- she was saying that -- she wishes that we had let her die.
Tom: And that surprises you?
Paul: I just think that it would be great if she could see Daniel.
Tom: You want me to bring my son to visit his mother in the hospital while she's hooked up to all these machines and there's a policeman standing outside?
Paul: Well, you are the D.A., Tom, you could dismiss the cop and you could prepare Daniel for a visit.
Tom: He's already having nightmares. He hasn't seen his mother in weeks.
Paul: Which is why I thought it would be a good idea for them to both see each other.
Tom: Oh, so now you know what's best for Emily?

Paul: No, I don't. I have no idea. Look, I just -- I know that she loves her son. And I know that Daniel is the one person in her life who has never hurt her. She needs something to live for, Tom. And I think it would be really good for Daniel to know that he was helping his mother. I don't know, it's just -- it's just an idea.

Carly: All right. Let's get you home.

But I'm not gonna do that because I'm focusing on what I really want. And just so you know, Nick is not on that list. There's just one name on there.

Luke: Okay, we don't have to go over this again.
Lily: You're right. I just want to understand -- you. See, I don't get a sense of your feelings, at all. Maybe that's what happens when your children grow up. You stop being able to read their minds.

Mike: I don't know. Mid-20s?
Jack: Height?
Mike: Height? I'd say around 5', not tall.
Jack: And when was the last place you saw her?

Mike: Now that I am sure of. I ran into her at the Oakdale Independence Day picnic -- it would have been around -- it would have been 1993. We hung out, she gave me the jewels and asked me to hang onto them.
Jack: According to forensics, those bones belonged to a young woman, same age and height as your friend Maya. And she died about 12, 13 years ago.
Mike: I hope you don't think I killed her. Jack, because I didn't -- I swear to God. I've never killed anybody.
Jack: I'm not accusing you of anything, Mike. I'm still collecting facts.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Susan: Paul, I hope you understand. Emily asked for you last night. But she's awake now and it's all changed. Her doctor --
Paul: Susan, I'll go. I just wanted to make sure she was awake.
Susan: Thank you.
Hal: Paul?
Paul: We're leaving.
Hal: She wants to see you.
Susan: Hal.
Hal: I think it's a good idea.
Susan: Go easy on her. You should go home, ya know? This can't be easy for you.
Meg: Well, it's not easy on anybody.
Paul: I saw Daniel.
Emily: Hal told me you saved my life.
Paul: Yeah, well, we were all pulling for you, Em.
Emily: But you hung in there. And you saved me. And I think I know why.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jade: I know this is hard.
Luke: No, Jade. Don't even start. The only reason that you don't want me to tell the truth is because you don't want to end your free ride.
Jade: You can't possibly think that.
Luke: No?
Jade: How many times do I have to tell you? This is not about the money. I am your friend. And I hate seeing you all torn up.
Luke: Jade, come on, give it a rest.
Jade: Maybe the best thing to do right now is like you said, think about other people.
[Luke groans]
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Cell phone rings]
Gwen: It's his voice mail. I can't leave him a message.
Casey: Why not?
Gwen: "Hi, honey, it's your wife. I'm going to Chicago."
Casey: It's an hour away. So what now?
Gwen: I'll go find him.
Casey: No. The bus leaves in like ten minutes! Call him on the way.
Gwen: Again, he'll have his phone turned off. He's got a bio exam.
Casey: So call him when we get to Chicago. It's not like we're hopping on a plane and flying to L.A.
Gwen: Okay, okay.
Casey: Okay.
Gwen: Okay.
Casey: Okay.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Will: You okay, man?
Luke: No.
Will: Well, what's up? I mean, I don't mean to butt in, but I just saw you and your girlfriend go at it.
Luke: She's not my girlfriend.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Katie: It's gorgeous.
Carly: I just need to take it in a touch and hem it a bit, and you'll be perfect.
Katie: Why are you doing this for me?
Carly: Because you're happy. And because you're going to do it right.
Katie: What do you mean?
Carly: You're not going to make the same mistakes that Jack and I made. You couldn't, you and Mike are open and honest with each other.
Katie: Well, it took a while. But yeah, we are.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Mike: Look, Jack, I appreciate you being so thorough and keeping an open mind. If you could just do me a favor and not mention this to Katie. Ever since she saw those bones, she's been pretty spooked.
Jack: Yeah, not a pretty sight.
Mike: Yeah, yeah. Look, just don't tell her I was here, okay? We're getting married tonight and she's got enough on her mind.
Jack: That works for now. Do you recognize this?
Mike: No, absolutely not.
Jack: It's a change purse we found with the body.
Mike: Well I've never seen it. It's not mine.
Jack: What about this?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Hal: She's a grown woman.
Susan: Doesn't matter. She's still my baby.
Paul: Look, we don't need to do this now, okay? You just need to rest.
Emily: I tried to kill myself, Paul. I wanted to die. And you saved me because you felt guilty.
Paul: No. I saved you because I want you to live. I don't want you to suffer. I think you're wonderful. I care about you. Em.
Emily: What does that mean? What does that mean, you care about me?
Paul: The important thing right now is that you focus on getting better.
Emily: Why?
Paul: Look, you can't make any decisions. Not now. Not in the state that you're in, all right? You're weak, you're injured. You need to heal. That's what's important.
Emily: And then what? Hmm? Will you be there for me? Will we be together?

Paul: What I'm trying to say --
Emily: You said you've moved on. I guess we both know why.
Katie: Nothing is going to stop me from marrying Mike.
Mike: All right, if I am a suspect, then you need to tell me. Because I've gotta tell Katie. I've gotta call off the wedding.
